snippet: Tarun Tejpal, a magazine editor charged with raping a younger journalist in a hotel elevator, said surveillance camera footage would help his case.
abstract: Indian magazine editor Tarun Tejpal, facing charges of raping a younger journalist in an elevator, says case against him is 'political vendetta' and that the police in Goa have refused to release surveillance camera footage that will prove encounter was not forced.
lead_paragraph: Tarun Tejpal, a magazine editor charged with raping a younger journalist in a hotel elevator, said surveillance camera footage would help his case.

headline.main: Indian Journalist Accused of Rape Claims ‘Political Vendetta’
headline.print_headline: India: Editor Facing Rape Charges Says Video Proves His Innocence
